intro: Ternstroemia verticillata, commonly known as the clustered ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with three to five leaflets arranged in a whorl. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
